== Mazal's scratch pad for learning and testing ==

Table of contents:

=== Objective 1 - learn table of contents ===
Code for table of contents is<<BR>>
{{{}}}

'''Note to self. Table of contents get's generated automatically using the headings you have in your document.'''<<BR>>

=== Objective 2 - learn headings ===

Headings are from 1 to 6. Headings have a number of = in front and behind. Amount of ='s determine heading level.<<BR>>
1 is biggest and boldest down to 6 smallest.<<BR>>
There is a space after <code>=</code> and then the heading begins and then a space and <code>=</code> again.<<BR>>
For example , a level 1 heading will be <code>= Level 1 heading =</code>

'''NOTE TO SELF: only 1 to 3 are bold. 4 is not but is capital letters. Try not to use lower level than 4.'''

=== Objective 3 - learn text formatting ===

'''NOTE TO SELF: Remember to put line breaks <code><<BR>></code> to get lines directly below each other.'''<<BR>>
'''The <code><<BR>></code> code is put only at the end of the line.'''

''italic'' is with double ' in front and behind. Remember to close behind otherwise whole line is italic.<<BR>>
'''bold''' is with triple ' in front and behind. Remember to close behind.<<BR>>
'''''bold plus italic test ''''' - Test bold and italic put together.<<BR>>
Code is placed inside of 3 {'s either side , for example <code>{{{code</code>}}}<<BR>>
__underline__ is done with 2 _'s on either side.<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HelpOnMoinWikiSyntax#Text_Formatting|Additional text formatting rules]]</nowiki>

=== Objective 4 - learn links ===

==== Internal links ====

<nowiki>[[mazal]]</nowiki> - A main page internally on the wiki - Simply put main page name between <code>[[]]</code><<BR>>
/pad - A subpage from the current wiki page - Simply put <code>/subpagename</code><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[mazal-pad]]</nowiki> - A subpage of a main page on internal wiki - simply put <code>mainpagename/subpagename</code> between <code>[[]]</code> <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[#start]]</nowiki> - Insert a link to an achorname on the current page. To put anchornames in the document the code {{{}}} must be used where you want to place the anchor.<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[#start|To start of page]]</nowiki> - Insert link to anchor , but put a description. Use <code><nowiki>[[#anchor|description]]</nowiki></code><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[mazal#start|Back to mazal main page]]</nowiki> - Insert link to anker on a main page , with a description. <code><nowiki>[[pagename#anchorname|description]]</nowiki></code><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[attachment:Gaming_Volgorde.txt]]</nowiki> - Link to an attached file. <code><nowiki>[[attachment:filename.txt]]</nowiki></code><<BR>>

==== External links ====

External links are mostly put in the format <code><nowiki>[[link|description]]</nowiki></code> with description , or simply <code><nowiki>[[link]]</nowiki></code> to not add a description. Simply just putting link also works.<<BR>>

<nowiki>[[http://www.consoleracing.co.za|Console Racing SA]]</nowiki><<BR>>
<nowiki>[[http://minetest.net]]</nowiki><<BR>>

To display an image on another site , the link to the image should be placed inbetween <code>{{</code>}} , for
example <code>{{http://static.moinmo.in/logos/moinmoin.png</code>}}<<BR>>

{{http://static.moinmo.in/logos/moinmoin.png}}

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/HelpOnMoinWikiSyntax#External_Links|Additional examples on external links]]</nowiki>

=== Objective 5 - Learn lists ===

Bullet lists are preceded with space and then <code>*</code> and a space. List can be "collapsed" by adding extra spaces in front
of the <code>*</code><<BR>>

'''Note to self: List lines do not have to be ended with line breaks if only list is used , but must be line braked if data is entered under each list item'''<<BR>>

* Item 1 - Test 1<<BR>>
 Testing of item 1

* Item 2<<BR>>
 Description and data of item 2

** Item 2.1
** Item 2.2
** Item 2.2.1

Numbered lists gets a space and a 1. in front instead of a <code>*</code>

# Item 1
# Item 2
## Item 2.1
## Item 2.2
# Item 3

=== Objective 6 - Learn Tables ===

A basic table layout :<<BR>>
<code>||'''A'''||'''B'''||'''C'''||</code><<BR>>
<code>||1      ||2      ||3      ||</code><<BR>>

'''Note to self: Tables do not need to end with line breaks , but if there is 2 tables after each other they must be split with a line break on an empty line between them. As well as a line break on an empty line after the last table.'''

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''This'''
| '''IS'''
| '''TABLES'''
|-
| It
| Certainly
| is
|}

<<BR>>
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| '''__Name__'''
| '''__Surname__'''
| '''__Nick__'''
|-
| Wikus
| van Dyk
| mazal
|}
